headline: Weekend Round-Up: XPeng's Middle East Expansion, China's EV Energy Limits, Waymo's Service Pause, Holiday Travel Chaos And Tesla's European Decline
summary: This week was a mixed bag for the tech and travel sectors. Chinese EV maker XPeng Inc. announced expansion plans in the Middle East and Africa, while China introduced new energy consumption standards for EVs. Meanwhile, Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo paused its services due to weather conditions and the holiday travel scene was thrown into chaos by a winter storm. Lastly, Tesla Inc.’s sales in Europe continued to decline. XPeng’s Middle East And Africa Expansion XPeng shares rose after the company unveil

headline: After a Year of Blistering Growth, AI Chip Makers Get Ready for Bigger 2026
summary: Driven by the explosive growth of artificial intelligence, the largest semiconductor companies in the world recorded more than $400 billion in combined sales in 2025, by far the biggest year for chips on record.  Hardware designers such as  Nvidia  which more than doubled its revenue year-over-year, are the main suppliers of the picks and shovels behind this new digital gold rush.

headline: Meta to Acquire Manus in $2 Billion Bet on AI Agents
summary: The deal values Manus at more than $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.  It marks a rare US acquisition of an Asian tech company and the latest multibillion-dollar AI bet from Meta Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg.  Meta intends to continue operating and selling the Manus service while also integrating it into its products, it said in a statement.

content.title: Meta to Acquire Manus in $2 Billion Bet on AI Agents

Meta intends to continue operating and selling the Manus service while also integrating it into its products, it said in a statement.

headline: AI Trade’s Next Leg Is All About Tech’s ‘Pick-and-Shovel’ Stocks
summary: Data storage companies dominated the S&P 500 Index in 2025, with Sandisk Corp. shares soaring almost 580% to make them the benchmark’s best performer, with Western Digital Corp. in second and Seagate Technology Holdings Plc in fourth.  Meanwhile, AI-linked power providers and cable and fiber producers such as Amphenol Corp., Corning Inc., NRG Energy Inc. and GE Vernova Inc. were among the Top 25.

headline: Nvidia in advanced talks to buy Israel's AI21 Labs for up to $3 billion, report says
summary: Nvidia is in advanced talks to buy Israel-based AI startup AI21 Labs for as much as $3 ​billion, the Calcalist financial daily reported on Tuesday.  Nvidia declined to ‌comment, while AI21 was not immediately available to comment.  Nvidia and Alphabet's Google participated in that funding.

content.title: Nvidia in advanced talks to buy Israel's AI21 Labs for up to $3 billion, report says

Nvidia declined to ‌comment, while AI21 was not immediately available to comment.  Nvidia and Alphabet's Google participated in that funding.

headline: What the Buffett Indicator says about the bull market, AI trade
summary: After 60 years at the top of one of the world's biggest investment firms, Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) CEO Warren Buffett will be handing off the leadership reins to Greg Abel at the end of 2025. The Oracle of Omaha was also noted to have invented the Buffett Indicator, which assesses the valuation of the stock market by dividing the total value of US stocks with the total US GDP (gross domestic product). Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on how much longer the Buffett Indicator may be calling for a continued bull market, while Miramar Capital Co-Founder and senior portfolio manager Max Wasserman comments on his outlook on the AI trade when factoring in Warren Buffett's market formula. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: What the Buffett Indicator says about the bull market, AI trade
content.description:
After 60 years at the top of one of the world's biggest investment firms, Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) CEO Warren Buffett will be handing off the leadership reins to Greg Abel at the end of 2025. The Oracle of Omaha was also noted to have invented the Buffett Indicator, which assesses the valuation of the stock market by dividing the total value of US stocks with the total US GDP (gross domestic product).

Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on how much longer the Buffett Indicator may be calling for a continued bull market, while Miramar Capital Co-Founder and senior portfolio manager Max Wasserman comments on his outlook on the AI trade when factoring in Warren Buffett's market formula.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

The Oracle of Omaha was also noted to have invented the Buffett Indicator, which assesses the valuation of the stock market by dividing the total value of US stocks with the total US GDP (gross domestic product). Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on how much longer the Buffett Indicator may be calling for a continued bull market, while Miramar Capital Co-Founder and senior portfolio manager Max Wasserman comments on his outlook on the AI trade when factoring in Warren Buffett's market formula. headline: Samsung’s First Trifold Phone Is Expensive and Half-Baked
summary: Samsung Electronics Co. became the first major player in 2019 to get in on the trend, and has kept at it since, releasing four new folding phones in 2025 alone, most recently the Galaxy Z TriFold.  Trifolds are an emerging subcategory of foldables, first attempted by Huawei Technologies Co. last year, that can take the form of both a smartphone and a widescreen tablet that’s well suited for watching videos.

content.title: Samsung’s First Trifold Phone Is Expensive and Half-Baked
content.summary: Samsung Electronics Co. became the first major player in 2019 to get in on the trend, and has kept at it since, releasing four new folding phones in 2025 alone, most recently the Galaxy Z TriFold.  Trifolds are an emerging subcategory of foldables, first attempted by Huawei Technologies Co. last year, that can take the form of both a smartphone and a widescreen tablet that’s well suited for watching videos.
